title: (x) Ben & Jerry's - Severance (proprietary) {Cerilene}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150327015028im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Copy%20of%20woody-scene-1024.jpg)
  
What font are the words "Ben & Jerry's" written in? I need a "G" letter in that font, for a school project. Alternatively is there a similar font, which I can download freely? I'd really appreciate help on this. Thank you...
author: divisionbiscuit

comments.content:
Found [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20150327015028/http:/typophile.com/node/3943) for you.

Looks like it's a custom font {Severance} that's not available. :( The above link has some other suggestions though.
Thanks Hazel. The Rat Fink Heavy font was the closest I think, but I don't really want to buy the whole font kit for a "G".
Can't you then scan the G and trace it in illustrator if that's all you need?

Actually they have two fonts:  
Chucky Regular (in the text Ben & Jerry)  
Severance (in the text “Vermont’s Finest)

Hope this helps.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150327015028im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Ben%20Jerry%20G.gif)
